channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Prince William addresses mental health issue
item.description: The Duke of Cambridge, 37, called for 'preparing for a very different mindset for mental health' as Britain slowly emerges out of a draconian 10-week lockdown imposed to fight coronavirus.

item.title: Donald Trump claims anti-conservative bias on social media is 'greatest threat to free speech'
item.description: The order could open Twitter, Facebook and Google to lawsuits by diluting legal protection which stops them from being liable for posts on their platforms.

item.title: Kate Garraway wipes away a tear as she claps for carers amid her husband Derek's COVID-19 battle
item.description: The Good Morning Britain presenter, 53, also took to Instagram to share an update about her spouse's COVID-19 battle and admitted she was emotional over the fact it could be the final one.

item.title: Minneapolis Mayor says George Floyd would still be alive if he were white
item.description: The Mayor of Minneapolis has said George Floyd would still be alive if he were white after protests erupted in the city overnight over his killing by police.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Clap for Carers occurs for maybe the last time
item.description: People all over the country have been taking to their doorsteps, balconies and windows to cheer and applaud NHS staff and key workers over the past ten weeks, amid the fight against coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Drug for children's disease had promising results
item.description: Ruxolitinib is a drug used to treat HLH, a severe systemic inflammatory syndrome in children that can be fatal and scientists believe it can prevent cytokine storms in coronavirus patients.

item.title: Two men die after being pulled from the River Avon in Bath
item.description: Emergency services were called at 4pm on Wednesday after it was reported that three people had fallen into the River Avon. Two men, believed to be in their 20s, were pronounced dead.

item.title: Coronavirus US: Trump 'would take hydroxychloroquine again'
item.description: President Donald Trump is feeling 'perfect' after a two-week regime of hydroxychloroquine and would take it again even after Dr. Anthony Fauci said it was not an effective treatment for coronavirus.

item.title: White man kicked out of office building after threatening to call the police on black businessmen
item.description: Tom Austin, pictured, thought a group of African American men were using their shared office gym unlawfully. They were a group of entrepreneurs working out of the same Minneapolis building.

item.title: Elon Musk spent three to four YEARS developing the white 'tuxedo' SpaceX suits
item.description: NASA astronauts suited up in SpaceX suits for the Wednesday Falcon 9 launch that Elon Musk said he worked on for 'three to four years,' and envisioned it to resemble a heroic tuxedo.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Civil liberties groups slam test and trace fine
item.description: Civil liberties groups have today slammed threats by health chiefs to fine Britons who do not obey the 14-day test and trace isolation rules - which have been dubbed a 'draconian intrusion of privacy'.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson says lockdown can be eased
item.description: Boris Johnson revealed that the draconian restrictions are being eased slightly from next week, after the ferocity of the outbreak subsided.

item.title: George Floyd left Texas prison to start new life in Minneapolis
item.description: George Floyd moved to Minneapolis in 2014 shortly after being released from prison in Houston, Texas following an arrest for aggravated robbery with a gun. Floyd died on Monday.

item.title: Chinese city of 2.8million braces for second wave of coronavirus cases from 'mysterious source'
item.description: The city of Mudanjiang has recorded a total of 11 domestic infections with no symptoms in the past three days, prompting local authorities to suspend flights and shut down public transport.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Dentists to reopen from 8 June
item.description: Sara Hurley, the Chief Dentistry Officer (CDO) for England, said dentists can start taking routine appointments in just 10 days - with some changes to surgeries to prevent the virus spreading.

item.title: Emily Maitlis seen out in London after Dominic Cummings scandal
item.description: The BBC is claimed to have had thousands of complaints about Ms Maitlis (pictured in London today) from Newsnight viewers but the corporation is refusing to release any figures.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: R-rate still near one as death toll hits 37,837
item.description: The Department of Health has announced the deaths of 377 more coronavirus patients while a blood-testing survey suggests some 4.5million people have had the virus.

item.title: Presence of Proxima b is CONFIRMED by scientists who say it may have liquid water and host life
item.description: Scientists have confirmed the presence of the Earth-like planet Proxima b. The team determined it receives the same amount of energy from its star as Earth does from the sun, suggesting it may host life.

item.title: Fast radio bursts reveal hidden low-density hot gas spread across the space between galaxies
item.description: The so-called 'missing baryon problem' emerged when cosmologists in the late nineties predicted that 5 per cent of the universe should be made of normal matter - but not enough appeared to be present..

item.title: Auction reveals story of British WWI captain's who helped the White Army during Russian civil war
item.description: Medals and photographs belonging to Birmingham-born Captain William Richardson revealed his role in helping fight communist Bolsheviks alongside the White Army in the Russian Civil War.

item.title: Trump expresses sorrow for 100,000 coronavirus deaths the morning after grim milestone
item.description: President Trump finally referenced the grim milestone of 100,000 Americans dying of the coronavirus in a Thursday morning tweet.

item.title: Deaf mother designs face masks with plastic window over the mouth to allow lip reading
item.description: Justine Bate, 42, from Manchester, made the masks to help herself and her daughter, Teona, 10, as they are both deaf. They sold 42 masks on the morning of May 27 for £5.99 each.

item.title: Breath-taking moment RAF's elite Red Arrows display team perform loop manoeuvre
item.description: Video shows Squadron leader Adam Collins flying alongside the crew near their base in RAF Scampton. Team photographer Corporal Adam Fletcher captured the Arrival Loop.

item.title: Ex-Labour spin chief Alastair Campbell is slammed for 'taking the p***' out of veterans
item.description: The two-minute video, which was posted to Twitter this afternoon, captures Campbell as he impersonates the Prime Minister recounting a bizarre meeting with the Queen.

item.title: New type of womb contraction in pregnant women could be a sign of pre-eclampsia
item.description: Researchers from the Nottingham University said blood flowed slowly through the placenta in healthy pregnancies, but in pre-eclampsia it was much more varied.

item.title: Premier League action to be shown on terrestrial television for the first time in the UK
item.description: The Premier League announced that all 92 remaining matches will be broadcast live in the UK by the League's existing broadcast partners - Sky Sports, BT Sport, BBC Sport and Amazon Prime.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein's suicide watch 'companion' says the pedophile financier killed himself
item.description: Former inmate Bill Mersey, who spent hours with Jeffrey Epstein at New York City's Metropolitan Correctional Center, says he died by suicide in his jail cell, despite murder conspiracy theories.

item.title: Debenhams announces axing of "hundreds" of staff
item.description: It is the latest round of redundancies to affect the cash-strapped business, which has closed multiple stores in recent years and filed for administration twice.

item.title: Chris Whitty and Sir Patrick Vallance say they 'don't want to get involved' in Cummings row
item.description: Durham Police today said Mr Cummings' 260-mile trip to Durham did not break lockdown rules while a 60-mile jaunt to a beauty spot only 'might have'.

item.title: Your wearable fitness trackers might detect coronavirus up to NINE DAYS before you have symptoms
item.description: Wearable tech companies have teamed up with researchers to develop an algorithm, which monitors the wearer's heart rate and temperature to see if unusual changes are a predictor of infection.

item.title: Mom accidentally flashes seven-year-old's classmates on Zoom
item.description: Ashley Foret Smith from Jacksonville, Florida shared the embarrassing moment in a viral Facebook video after her seven-year-old daughter surprised her.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Several' vaccines could be ready by end of year
item.description: AstraZeneca CEO Pascal Soriot said it was on track to produce millions of its COVID-19 jab - developed by Oxford University researchers and called AZD1222 - by September.

item.title: Cat dubbed the 'Beast of Billionaire's Row' may be EATING tycoons' pets to survive, neighbour claims
item.description: Armed officers and a helicopter were deployed in the hunt for the animal when it was spotted in north London earlier this week.

item.title: World's largest all-electric aircraft took to the skies for the first time
item.description: For the first flight a test pilot took to the skies alone but the plane can seat nine passengers. It's hoped a commercial version will be available next year with a 100-mile range.

item.title: German teacher, 25, is held after child, 3, dies of respiratory failure
item.description: Sandra M., teacher at a kindergarten in the western town of Viersen, was arrested on suspicion of murder on 19 May, two weeks after a three-year-old child under her care died.

item.title: Baby girl has second mouth with lips, teeth and tongue removed
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT. The 0.8-inch mass was spotted at week 28 of pregnancy but thought to be a cyst. She was born in Charleston, South Carolina.
item.media:credit: Alexandra O Hamberis; David Macias; Clarice Clemmens; Krishna G Patel / BMJ

item.title: USAF F-15E Strike Eagle warplanes stop off at RAF Lakenheath after flying missions over Syria
item.description: The elite American warplanes are on their way home to Mountain Home base in Idaho after stopping by the Suffolk base which hosts USAF units and personnel earlier this week.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson accused of silencing experts
item.description: Durham Police have said that Dominic Cummings did break lockdown rules when he travelled 50 miles to Barnard Castle.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Scotland's lockdown will ease TOMORROW
item.description: Scottish First minister Nicola Sturgeon unveiled the move in Edinburgh hours before Boris Johnson is due to make his tweaks to the draconian coronavirus curbs,

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Pubs could reopen if social distancing at 1m
item.description: Emma McClarkin, chief executive of the British Beer and Pub Association said if the two-metre guidance remains, just one-third could reopen.

item.title: Tony Scannell dead: The Bill star passes away aged 74
item.description: The Irish actor's cause of death has not yet been revealed, but his passing was confirmed by a friend, who posted a Facebook tribute on Wednesday. He is survived by his partner Agnes Lillis.

item.title: UK Weather: Driest May ever set to continue with 82F weekend
item.description: Parts of the UK are on track for the driest May yet, with temperatures set to hit 82F (28C) in isolated UK spots today, leaving Jumbles Reservoir in Bolton (pictured) on the verge of totally drying up.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: RNLI slammed as THREE die on coastline
item.description: The RNLI suspended patrols along the coast in March because of coronavirus, and has announced plans to restart them at 70 of the usual 240 beaches this summer.

item.title: Normal People fans copy Daisy Edgar-Jones's signature haircut
item.description: Actress Daisy Edgar-Jones, 22, from London, sported effortless choppy bangs when playing Marianne in the BBC's popular show - and viewers shared their own versions on Instagram.

item.title: Age UK adviser, 71, suffers stab wounds and wife, 71, is fighting for life after 'domestic incident'
item.description: Neighbours named Mervyn Kohler (pictured) as the man who was found at the Islington house with stab wounds. His condition is not thought to be life-threatening.

item.title: Woman shares photo with boyfriend flashing in the background
item.description: Shannon Butt, 22,from Gloucestershire, was left crying with laughter after she noticed her boyfriend wiping his bottom in the background of one of her selfies.- and posted the hilarious results on Twitter.

item.title: Baby girl is left 'seriously injured' and woman is fighting for her life in hospital
item.description: Ambulance crews and West Midlands Police were called to the property in Tipton, near Dudley, at around 12.30am today after a woman, 37, and seven-month-old baby suffered serious injuries.

item.title: Lori Loughlin's daughters Olivia Jade and Bella encouraged her to plead guilty
item.description: 'The girls have been very supportive of their parents throughout this whole ordeal,' a legal source told the site. 'They were encouraging their parents to fight this, but that's obviously all changed.'

item.title: Capri @ The Vine, Wakefield is slammed by neighbours for holding garden party during lockdown
item.description: An Italian restaurant in Wakefield has sparked fury among neighbours and nearby publicans after is hosted a Bank Holiday 'disco'. Police had to be called to break up a party in Capri @ The Vine's garden.

item.title: JANET STREET-PORTER: Good luck with Test and Trace
item.description: The Government is using a life-threatening virus as an excuse to authorise a huge level of intrusion into our personal lives, writes JANET STREET-PORTER.

item.title: Woman born with 12 toes and webbed fingers has to have her feet amputated
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT. Laura Booze, from Millersport, Ohio, was born with polydactyly and syndactyly, which cause extra fingers or toes, and fused digits, respectively.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Government's contact tracing site crashes
item.description: Doctors and other staff reported major teething troubles as the much-trumpeted scheme finally got up and running, with some saying they had not even received passwords to start work.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Matt Hancock laughs about contact tracing app
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock was told it was 'not a laughing matter' as he chuckled at suggestions he had rushed the system in before it is actually ready.

item.title: Amir Khan flouts lockdown rules AGAIN for family reunion after 18 month feud
item.description: The boxer, his wife Faryal Makhdoom and their three children visited his parents at their home in Bolton earlier this week to celebrate Eid al-Fitr.

item.title: Domino's delivery driver follows special delivery instructions to give doorbell camera a high-five
item.description: Elizabeth Beem ordered a pizza in Falcon, Colorado, with special instructions. The driver kicked her door three times and high-fived a porch security camera before running off in a hilarious video.

item.title: Forget Tiger King, Kenya offers the real deal and here's how to see it in Out of Africa style
item.description: Roar Africa arranged a five-day Out of Africa tour for Frank Mannion. 'Robert Redford's first return trip to Africa was organised by Roar, so I was happy to follow in his footsteps,' writes Frank.

item.title: UK's first Covid-secure hairdresser reveals the 'new normal'
item.description: The Gatsby & Miller salon in Amersham, Buckinghamshire, includes a digital screen in the window to display important reminders and clients being welcomed by one mask-wearing stylist.

item.title: Experienced glider pilot who was killed after part of his plane fell off didn't hear warning shouts
item.description: Steve Evans, 54, from Glynneath, Wales, who was killed after a section of his tailplane fell off, was unable to hear flying club members shout warnings from the ground as the plane took off.

item.title: Couple travel world to find movie locations and recreate scenes, from Forest Gump to La La Land
item.description: Robin Lachhein and Judith Schneider, from Germany, post images of their amazing recreations to their Instagram page, Secret Famous Places, which has a following of more than 20,000 people.

item.title: Apple lands Martin Scorsese movie Killers of the Flower Moon starring De Niro and DiCaprio
item.description: Apple Inc is signing on to produce director Martin Scorsese's next movie Killers of the Flower Moon after a fierce bidding war between top studios, insiders confirmed Wednesday.

item.title: LG Poland apologises for posting 'upskirting' phone ad
item.description: LG Poland was forced to apologise for a lewd video it posted on short video platform TikTok earlier this week. The 12-second clip showed a young woman being photographed as she walked up stairs.
item.media:credit: GRABS: LG advert from Poland shows man creepily taking upstart pictures

item.title: Electric car owners PAID to charge as prices turned negative
item.description: For some customers of Octopus Energy, plenty of sun, wind and low demand for power meant their electric vehicles earned money by charging.

item.title: Nissan car production in Europe will be centred at Sunderland plant
item.description: Nissan bosses announced that the Sunderland plant will become the hub for production of core models for Europe after confirming the closure of its Spanish factory, where workers have been protesting.

item.title: Rampaging hippos kill at least 10 in five months in Kenya
item.description: In the midst of the coronavirus pandemic, the counties surrounding Lake Victoria in the east African nation have suffered from heavy rain, increasing the threat from wildlife attacking locals.

item.title: Tinder launches feature allowing singletons to add facts about themselves to their profiles
item.description: Tinder has launched Prompts which display question-and-answer cards on users profiles on topics including their pet, favourite songs and past-times. Usage has surged 12 per cent.

item.title: Dog walkers find wreckage of WWII RAF fighter plane on Cleethorpes beach
item.description: Dog walkers at Cleethorpes, Grimsby, were stunned to stumble across the seaweed-matted remains of the Bristol Beaufighter, which was dredged up by moving sands.

item.title: China approves national security law bill for Hong Kong amid international controversy
item.description: The bill gives Beijing draconian powers to punish 'secession, subversion, terrorism and foreign interference' and allows its secret police to operate openly in Hong Kong.

item.title: 'You're not even pedalling!' Frustrated driver unleashes a priceless foul-mouthed rant at cyclist
item.description: In the video driver Owain Morgans, 40, is heard directing a tirade of expletives at the 'slow cyclist' in Llanelli, South Wales. The bike then overtakes, cycling through a red light.

item.title: ITV confirm Emmerdale will remain on air and will switch to two episodes a week
item.description: ITV have confirmed Emmerdale will remain on air and will continue to broadcast episodes, it was revealed on Thursday, after becoming the first British soap to resume filming.

item.title: Eothen Homes, North Tyneside lets residents meet relatives face to face
item.description: Elderly residents at Eothen care home in Whitley Bay have been able to meet loved ones face to face for the first time in weeks after tests revealed none of the home's staff or residents had caught the virus.

item.title: Not their brightest idea! Social media users share snaps of hilarious design fails
item.description: Collated by Shareably, baffled social media users from around the globe have posted a series of funny examples of spectacular design flaws they came across in every day life.

item.title: Mother mocked after 'travel potty' she made out of nappies for an hour car journey leaked
item.description: An anonymous mother who lives in the UK told Mumsnet that she created a 'travel potty' to use during a long drive to see her mum to avoid using her bathroom and breaching lockdown rules.

item.title: Countess Alexandra Tolstoy reveals she has been evicted with her three children
item.description: Countess Alexandra Tolstoy has revealed that she has been evicted from her multi-million home with only 12 days notice during the coronavirus outbreak in an emotional Instagram post.

item.title: Sea snakes have been adapting to see underwater for 15 million years
item.description: Genes in the eyes of sea snakes evolved rapidly over the course of 15 million years to allow them to see underwater, according to an international team of scientists.

item.title: Twitter 'fact checks' two-month-old tweets by China as Trump threatens web giants with bias probes
item.description: Exclamation point warnings marked, 'Get the facts about COVID-19,' were added to tweets from spokesman Lijian Zhao, who claimed: 'It might be US army who brought the epidemic to Wuhan.'

item.title: Protesters descend on the streets of Minneapolis for a second night over the death of George Floyd
item.description: Minneapolis police are reportedly investigating a homicide after the owner of a pawn shop shot and killed a looter as chaos erupted on day two of protests over the death of George Floyd.

item.title: 'Master Thief' behind infamous Ocean's Eleven-style heist fights for his freedom
item.description: Sean Murphy, 55, was described by the FBI as one of the best burglars around. Now he is arguing for his freedom, claiming that he has already served his time and should be released.

item.title: QI reveals the bizarre BBC guidelines followed in the 1940s
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The BBC's long-running comedy quiz show QI has revealed the bizarre and strict guidelines issued by the broadcaster in the 1940s.

item.title: 'A murderer lives here': Protesters brand home of white cop over George Floyd's death
item.description: Protesters gathered outside the home of Derek Chauvin Wednesday in anger over the death of George Floyd.

item.title: Coronavirus: Swiss brothels to reopen on 6 June - with rules
item.description: Swiss brothels have been given the green light to open on June 6 as the country exits lockdown, with strict health rules including keeping your faces 'one forearm length apart' during sex.

item.title: Liverpool shopkeeper whacks attacker with a broom before the fleeing man runs into traffic
item.description: The strange attack happened at a Bargain Beers on Prescot Road in Liverpool on May 15 at 8.35pm. Uber driver Trandaf Laurentiu filmed the shopkeeper hitting the attacker with a broom.

item.title: Wannabe country gents can be lord of the manor with this Palladian house - for just under £5million
item.description: The lavish Chineway Farm property in Devon was transformed from a working farm into the sprawling estate it is today. Lords of the manor will move into a secluded area near the Jurassic Coast.

item.title: Iranian state media accused of editing photo of 13-year-old beheaded by her father
item.description: Romina Ashrafi, 13, was beheaded by her father with a sickle in an apparent honour killing - before an Iranian newspaper apparently photoshopped an image of her to hide her hair.

item.title: Moment burglars posing as police officers raid luxury country estate
item.description: Daniel Kelly, 41, pictured, and Louis Aherne, 31, from Charlton, south east London were part of a three-man burglary gang who impersonated police officers during a raid in Sevenoaks, Kent.

item.title: Cineworld is planning to reopen ALL of its cinemas in July
item.description: As theatres open across the Europe and elsewhere, Cineworld has announced that it is implementing new safety measures in light of the coronavirus pandemic and that venues will open in July.

item.title: Man with chronic lung condition makes 'miracle' recovery
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Janine, 33, and 40-year-old Stewart Armstrong, of Ramsgate, Kent, got married in 2018 after Stewart was given three years to live at most due to chronic pulmonary aspergillosis.

item.title: Fox cub gets a ringside seat as two snarling badgers battle it out in amazing night-time footage
item.description: Amateur photographer Rodney Holbrook captured the fight with a hidden camera near his home in Severn Beach near Bristol on Monday. A fox sat unmoved as the badgers bit each other.

item.title: Anti-Semitic crime rises in Germany, most from far right
item.description: It comes amid an overall strong increase in right-extremist criminality that is a cause for 'great concern,' Interior Minister Horst Seehofer said Wednesday.
item.media:description: Federal police officers carry a box with secured documents during raids in Leipzig, Germany, Wednesday, May 27, 2020. Police in Germany have raided dozens of homes linked to anti-government groups suspected of manufacturing fake documents. (Peter Endig/dpa via AP)

item.title: Gymnast, 10, works out for 30 hours a week and gets up at 5.30am
item.description: Lyza Brooks Mosier, 10, from Georgia, which implemented lockdown measures on April 3, is in pristine shape after waking up at 5.30am five days a week to workout for a total of 30 hours.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Bank of England warns recovery will be tough
item.description: Governor Andrew Bailey made clear a fresh wave of quantitative easing - effectively printing money - will be needed as he raised doubts about the prospects for a rapid bounceback.

item.title: Ex-girlfriend of 'Babes in the Wood' murderer appears in court
item.description: Jenny Johnson, pictured left on the steps of Brighton Magistrates' Court today, appeared in court having been charged with perjury and perverting the course of justice.

item.title: Couple's fury as council plan to build giant quarry 100 metres from dream Grade II-listed home
item.description: Barbara and Simon Campbell purchased the 16th century manor house, complete with 15 acres of land, at an auction for £270,000 in 1999, but little did they know of dormant planning permission.

item.title: Fruit Snack Challenge attempt by twins ends in tears - but only for one of them
item.description: Twins Hailey and Hayden Larkin, two, from Delaware County, Pennsylvania, attempted the challenge. 'Go-getter' Hayden stole all the candies after ICU nurse mom Lisa left the room and her sister cried.

item.title: Remarkable time-lapse footage shows secondary school being built in 12 WEEKS during lockdown
item.description: Sir Frederick Gibberd College in Harlow was built in record time during the coronavirus lockdown. The school was constructed using 198 modules which were attached 'like Lego'.

item.title: Up to 95% of heatwave deaths in London and west Midlands occur below weather warning threshold
item.description: Scientists have called on Public Health England to review its emergency plan for hot weather, which is based on the 2003 heatwave where 2,000 people died.

item.title: Mobile app Bits says it can boost your credit score for a monthly fee
item.description: The app is intended to build up your Experian credit score using a monthly fee closer to a subscription service than a credit card. In fact, it doesn't even give you a card to buy things.

item.title: BBC Breakfast host Naga Munchetty shows off the results of her DIY haircut
item.description: BBC Breakfast host Naga Munchetty revealed her DIY haircut to viewers on Thursday after saying she 'couldn't take it anymore.'

item.title: Bus driver leaves viewers in tears with his message of defiance
item.description: Grant, from Manchester, read aloud the touching poem he had penned amid the COVID-19 crisis in last night's Channel 4 documentary Britain's Unsung Heroes.

item.title: VW van rams Citroen C3 into signpost before gunman opens fire at the fleeing car passengers
item.description: After the dramatic crash on a residential street in Balsall Heath, Birmingham, a van passenger chases after people running away from the wrecked car, and appears to be pointing a gun at them.

item.title: How will the coronavirus test and trace system work?
item.description: The much-delayed scheme was unveiled at yesterday's coronavirus press conference by Health Secretary Matt Hancock, who said it was the 'civic duty' of the public to adhere to the new rules.

item.title: Fossil of a toothless pterosaur commonly found in China and Brazil is discovered in the UK
item.description: The petrified remains of the flying reptile - its jawbone - was spotted by a dog walker in Sandown Bay, on the island's south-east coast.

item.title: Police release bodycam footage they claim exonerates cop and shows George Floyd's 'buddies' detained
item.description: Bodycam footage from an officer at the scene of the arrest of George Floyd appears to show the cop speaking to two of the man's friends and trying to reassure them an ambulance is on it's way.

item.title: Dog that was hanged by a metal noose and left for dead with a broken skull makes miracle recovery
item.description: Chris and Lara Jessop from Skipton, North Yorks, rescued five-year-old Vizsla, Deru, from Hungary after he was found by Hungarian charity, Vizslamentes.

item.title: Woman, 24, is arrested on suspicion of murdering 13-week-old baby girl
item.description: A murder probe is under way by Hampshire Constabulary after a 13-week-old baby girl died at a property in Gosport, Hampshire, after falling 'seriously unwell'.

item.title: Boy, 15, beats sister, 10, to death with a hammer in her sleep during row over the family tablet
item.description: The girl, named as Luda, was hammered to death at her home Taraz, northern Kazakhstan. She was found with a broken skull and died from horrific injuries before paramedics arrived at the scene.

item.title: Cancer, asthma and transplant patients are ditched from Government's coronavirus shielding list
item.description: Patients in England and Wales with various health conditions that raise their risk of dying from COVID-19 were told they had been removed from the scheme in the GOV.UK text last Friday.

item.title: Duke and Duchess of Cambridge will 'send message to Government' if Princess Charlotte is off school
item.description: Appearing on Good Morning Britain, royal editor Russell Myers explained the move would send a 'message' if they decided to keep Charlotte away from Thomas's Battersea.

item.title: It's about to kick off! Giraffe gets its leg caught on a smaller rival's neck as they square up
item.description: Conservation biologist Angela Ferguson, 28, shared the comic moment when the giraffe scooped its neck under the other's leg in a very awkward stand-off at Zambezi National Park, Zimbabwe.

item.title: It's about to kick off! Giraffe gets its leg caught on a smaller rival's neck as they square up
item.description: Conservation biologist Angela Ferguson, 28, shared the comic moment when the giraffe scooped its neck under the other's leg in a very awkward stand-off at Zambezi National Park, Zimbabwe.

item.title: Hilarious moment Indy the cat discovers his owner's treadmill and cautiously tries to use it
item.description: The cat from northwest Turkey was filmed playing on the running machine last week. Indy, one, falls off the treadmill. His owner, YouTuber Walter Santi, said: 'He was a little scared at first.'

item.title: Heartbreaking video shows toddler playing next to his mother's body in India
item.description: Arbina Khatoon, 35, died at Muzaffarpur station, in northern India, on Wednesday after making a punishing 1,000mile journey in an attempt to get home amid the country's lockdown.

item.title: Civil servant, 61, who was a size 20 lost five stone
item.description: Denise Elias, 61, from Cardiff, dropped from 15st 13lb to 10st 3lb in order to give beloved adopted Chihuahua cross Gizmo the 'best life possible'. She has dropped from a size 20 to a size 12.

item.title: Royal Family shares recipe for the Queen's Victoria Sponge cake
item.description: Posting to the Royal Family's official Instagram account , the Buckingham Palace cooks revealed their method for making the famous sponge cake in 15 simple steps.

item.title: Alton Towers crash survivors Leah Washington and Joe Pugh celebrate five years together
item.description: Alton Towers Smiler crash survivor Leah Washington and Joe Pugh celebrated their fifth anniversary - almost five years to the day they enjoyed their first date at the amusement park on June 2nd 2015.

item.title: Man cleared of storming a house with a machete for a stranger's sex fantasy - at the WRONG address
item.description: Two men hired to carry out a stranger's sexual fantasy of being tied up while clad in his underpants went to the wrong NSW rural address with machetes but politely left after realising their mistake.

item.title: Trainee accountant receives suspended jail term for stealing £60,000
item.description: Trainee accountant Jake Currie, pictured, received a two-year suspended jail sentence after he stole £60,000 from Nuco Travel in Cheadle, Greater Manchester.

item.title: Macron battles to salvage image after it emerges France burned a BILLION masks before coronavirus
item.description: It has emerged that masks believed to be too old for use were destroyed and not replaced as France scaled back its pandemic planning after neither Sars nor swine flu were as deadly as predicted.

item.title: McVitie's reveals the exact way to dunk its biscuits including how many times and the correct angle
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Dr Stuart Farrimond, based in the UK, shared his findings with FEMAIL after performing an experiment to determine which biscuits best suit dunking.

item.title: Perfectly preserved Roman mosaic floor unearthed in an Italian vineyard
item.description: The floor, found in a hilly area above the town of Negrar di Valpolicella near Verona, was uncovered just a week after archaeologists returned to work from lockdown.

item.title: Now betting giant WILL have to pay £3.5million fine over death of addict
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Chris Bruney (pictured), from Sheffield, took his own life hours after being plied with £400 of bonuses by staff at online casino Winner.co.uk, which is owned by Playtech.

item.title: Credit card crunch continues as interest-free terms hit a record low
item.description: The number of interest-free credit card deals has fallen to a record low for the second successive month, as banks continue to slash the availability of unsecured debt.

item.title: The brands with the best-rated dealer networks in the UK revealed
item.description: When it comes to servicing and repairs, it's Japanese manufacturers that dominate the rankings in a survey of 18,000 car owners in Britain.

item.title: Australian woman develops bizarre disease
item.description: Perth nail technician Tenika Nicotra, 24, can hear the sound of her heartbeat and the movement of her eyes- a symptom of Superior Canal Dehiscence Syndrome (SCDS).

item.title: Brazil tops more than 25,000 coronavirus deaths as the country emerges as latest Covid-19 epicentre
item.description: Brazil's coronavirus death toll topped 25,000 on Wednesday as the country emerged as the latest epicentre in the crisis. The health ministry confirmed 1,086 deaths in the past 24 hours.

item.title: Perverted Thai man steals 126 pairs of thongs, rubs them all over his body and has sex with them
item.description: Thai man Theerapat Klaiya, 24, has confessed to stealing more than 100 pairs of thongs which he would rub on his body and have 'sex' with them.

item.title: Australian dating expert Louanne Ward reveals the personality traits men desire most in a woman
item.description: Men are most interested in honest, confident women with an appetite for fun, an online poll conducted by Perth dating coach Louanne Ward has revealed.

item.title: Incredible moment surfer saves stranded dog after its owner's kayak overturned in Queensland
item.description: Vasco Vellez was on his hydrofoil surfboard at Currumbin in the Gold Coast when he noticed a kayak flip on the waves on Sunday.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... lockdown breaches
item.description: 'It's much harder to police lockdown breaches since the Dominic Cummings affair'
